Prevent malformed WWW-Authenticate headers from causing infinite loops

The `Mechanize::HTTP::WWWAuthenticateParser` parser gets stuck in a loop
in some cases when the WWW-Authenticate header is malformed.

The string scanner will continue to loop if it has not reached the end
of the header string AND if the remainder of the string does not contain a
recognisable auth-scheme.

This PR changes the behaviour such that it  will break out of the loop
if the remaining header string is not recognisable (rather than getting
stuck in a loop).

Ensure Agent#response_read does not lose page on bad content-length

Before this commit invalid content length (that is, length which does
not match Content-Length header) would raise an EOFError and as a
side effect, lose all page content. This will now instead raise
a Mechanize::ResponseReadError which you can then force parse the
response through. Like so:

    begin
      page = agent.get 'http://google.com'
    rescue Mechanize::ResponseReadError => e
      page = e.force_parse
    end

A quick whack at allowing additional HTTP headers to be passed in to a get() call.

Note that get(), fetch_page() and set_headers() all now have the
ability to accept a hash of arguments as a parameter, allowing us
to "stuff" extra parameters into each one while maintaining
backwards compatibility (see tests).

Special headers specified by :etag and :if_modified_since are
recognized, for whatever that's worth.

I realize this is kind of a fundamental change for such a simple
feature, but it looks like there are some API changes planned for
0.8.0 anyway, so I figured I'd throw this out there and start a
conversation about it.
